transliteration: Hooo Sron Hoonan|| Bhayo An Chhodhnan||
translation: The demon-chief Rakat Beej became bloodless and his limbs became very weak.

transliteration: Girio Ant Jhooman|| Mano Megh Bjooman||44||121||
translation: Ultimatley he fell down on the ground wavering like the clound on he earth.44.121.

transliteration: Sabhai Dev Harkhe|| Souman Dhaar Barkhe||
translation: All the gods were pleased (to see this) and they showered the flowers.

transliteration: Rakat Bind Mdare|| Sabai Sant Oubhare||45||122||
translation: Rakat Beej was killed and in this way the goddess saved the saints.45.122.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtky cMfI cirqRy rkq bIrj bDh cqurQ iDAwie sMpUrx msqu suB msqu ]4]APjU ]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Bachitra Naatake Channdoo Charitre Rakat Booraj Badhah Churth Dhooaae Sanpooran Moust(u) Soubh Mast(u)||4||afjoo||
translation: Thus the Fourth Chapter entitled “The Killing of Rakat Beej” of Chandi Charitra of BACHITTAR is completed.4.
Now the battle with Nisumbh is described:

gurmukhi: suMB insuMB suxXo jbY rkq bIrj ko nws ]
transliteration: Sounbh Nisounbh Sounyo Jabhai Rakat Booraj Ko Naas||
translation: When Sumbh and Nisumbh heard about the destruction of Rakat Beej;

gurmukhi: Awp cVq By jor dl sjy prs Ar pwis ]1]123]
transliteration: Aap Chadat Bhe Jor Dal Saje Paras Ar Paas(i)||1||123||
translation: They marched forward themselves gathering their forces and bedecking themselves with axes and nooses.1.123.
The mighty warriors Sumbh and Nisumbh began the invasion.

gurmukhi: auTy n`d nwdM su Dausw DukwrM ]
transliteration: Outhe Nadd Naadan Su Dhaousaa Dhoukaaran||
translation: The sound of musical instruments and trumpets resounded.
